courseGoal: To turn self-awareness into consistent action, staying calm in challenge, communicating honestly, and keeping a steady rhythm of effort, rest, and presence.
whereIAmNow: I‚Äôm more aware of my triggers and reactive habits. I‚Äôve started using small, consistent practices to stay grounded and intentional.
whereIWantToBe: I want to live in line with my values, staying calm under pressure, speaking with honesty, and maintaining balance and presence every day.

coreAttributes.name: Strength
coreAttributes.summary: I‚Äôm consistent and disciplined, but still push too far at times, forgetting to recover until I feel drained.
coreAttributes.description: Strength means knowing when to push and when to rest. My next step is valuing recovery as part of the training.

coreAttributes.name: Dexterity
coreAttributes.summary: I adapt well and can reset quickly, but slip into overthinking before acting when I doubt myself.
coreAttributes.description: Dexterity means trust in flow. I‚Äôm learning to move first and refine through feedback instead of pre‚Äëplanning everything.

coreAttributes.name: Constitution
coreAttributes.summary: I handle stress much better now, though I sometimes ignore early signs of overload until I crash.
coreAttributes.description: I‚Äôm improving at self-regulation and recovery. My goal is to catch tension earlier and reset before it builds.

coreAttributes.name: Intelligence
coreAttributes.summary: Reflection and structure are strong, but I still drift into overthinking instead of acting.
coreAttributes.description: I‚Äôm learning to turn reflection into decision‚Äîending each journaling session with one tangible action.

coreAttributes.name: Wisdom
coreAttributes.summary: I read patterns well and understand others deeply but lose perspective when tired or emotionally charged.
coreAttributes.description: Wisdom grows when I slow down, breathe, and come back to observation over judgment.

coreAttributes.name: Charisma
coreAttributes.summary: I‚Äôm more honest and open, though I still soften my message or avoid tension out of caution.
coreAttributes.description: I‚Äôm practicing speaking simply and directly, trusting clarity over comfort.

focusAreas.name: Presence & Flow
focusAreas.theme: From overthinking to calm, embodied awareness
focusAreas.purpose: To handle challenges calmly instead of reacting or freezing.
focusAreas.coreChallenge: Overthinking and trying to control outcomes when under stress.
keyPractices: Take mindful walks or movement breaks every day.
Pause during work to relax and reset attention.
focusAreas.growthIndicator: Able to stay calm and aware instead of reactive.

focusAreas.name: Authentic Expression
focusAreas.theme: From avoidance to open, confident communication
focusAreas.purpose: To express truth and boundaries clearly and respectfully.
focusAreas.coreChallenge: Avoiding hard conversations or reacting defensively.
keyPractices: Pause in conflict and choose a responsible, calm response.
Try to see the intention behind the other person‚Äôs behavior.
focusAreas.growthIndicator: Communication feels honest, direct, and builds trust.

focusAreas.name: Purposeful Discipline
focusAreas.theme: From reactive effort to steady, sustainable consistency
focusAreas.purpose: To build self-trust through steady, realistic habits.
focusAreas.coreChallenge: Staying consistent with healthy routines during stress.
keyPractices: Do a short journaling session each night.
Keep a relaxing pre-bed routine to improve recovery.
focusAreas.growthIndicator: Habits feel natural and supportive instead of forced.

focusAreas.name: Fitness & Flexibility
focusAreas.theme: From effort to flexible, sustainable movement
focusAreas.purpose: To increase overall fitness, agility, and endurance in a balanced way.
focusAreas.coreChallenge: Maintaining discipline without turning fitness into pressure or overtraining.
keyPractices: Walk or move daily with the goal of 10,000 steps.
Incorporate stretching or mobility work after workouts.
Use physical training as a way to reset mentally as well as physically.
focusAreas.growthIndicator: Fitness and flexibility steadily improve without burnout or strain.

supportingPractices.name: Daily Meditation
supportingPractices.purpose: To stay centered, reset energy, and maintain balance.

supportingPractices.name: Reflective Journaling
supportingPractices.purpose: To process the day, learn from patterns, and make adjustments.

supportingPractices.name: Strength Training
supportingPractices.purpose: To build physical and mental resilience, balanced with rest.

supportingPractices.name: 10,000 Steps Daily
supportingPractices.purpose: To stay active, support recovery, and improve cardiovascular health.

supportingPractices.name: Healthy Diet
supportingPractices.purpose: To support strength, focus, and recovery with balanced nutrition and a high-protein diet.

notes.note: Aim for whole, minimally processed foods.
Prioritize lean proteins, complex carbs, and healthy fats.
Stay hydrated and plan meals around training days.

strategy.name: Strategy for Growth
yearlyGoals: Live in alignment with my values: calm, authentic, balanced, and physically strong.

quarterlyGoals.Q1: Build consistent daily and weekly routines for awareness, strength, and stability.
quarterlyGoals.Q2: Shift from practicing awareness to naturally embodying it in everyday life.
quarterlyGoals.Q3: Stay balanced and mindful through high-stress periods while maintaining fitness routines.
quarterlyGoals.Q4: Communicate confidently and live authentically across all areas of life.

monthlyGoals: Solidify my fitness foundation by walking 10,000 steps each day.
Maintain consistency with strength training and stretching.
Follow a high-protein, balanced diet to support recovery and energy.
Use daily journaling to track energy, mood, and progress.
weeklyGoals: Reflect weekly to notice growth and adjust habits.
Pause during conflict to see others‚Äô perspectives and respond calmly.
Take one full rest day for recovery and mental reset.
dailyGoals: Start with a calm walk or meditation.
Reach at least 10,000 steps throughout the day.
Stop working a few hours before bedtime.
Relax before bed with tea or meditation.
Write a short nightly journal entry.
Do a short workout or yoga session.
